definition: a summons issued after the filing of a libel or claim directing all parties concerned to show cause why the judgment asked for should not be granted
details:
noun
- a summons issued after the filing of a libel or claim directing all parties concerned to show cause why the judgment asked for should not be granted
= synonyms: process of monition
- cautionary advice about something imminent (especially imminent danger or other unpleasantness)
= example: cautionary advice about something imminent (especially imminent danger or other unpleasantness)
= synonyms: admonition, warning, word of advice
- a firm rebuke
= synonyms: admonition, admonishment
